de.ntcomputer.minecraft.controllablemobs.api.ai.behaviors

Class AITargetHurtBy

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ntcomputer.minecraft.controllablemobs.api.ai.behaviors.AIBehavior<E>
      • de.ntcomputer.minecraft.controllablemobs.api.ai.behaviors.AITargetBehavior<Creature>
        • de.ntcomputer.minecraft.controllablemobs.api.ai.behaviors.AITargetHurtBy

  • public class AITargetHurtBy
extends AITargetBehavior<Creature>
    Target behavior: When the entity is being attacked, it will attack its attacker back. This new target will override any other target unless you use ControllableMobActions.target(org.bukkit.entity.LivingEntity).
    Version:
    v4
    Author:
    Cybran

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AITargetHurtBy()
      Create with an automatically given priority.
      AITargetHurtBy(boolean crowdAttack)
      Create with an automatically given priority, optionally causing a crowd attack.
      AITargetHurtBy(int priority)
      Create with a custom priority.
      AITargetHurtBy(int priority, boolean crowdAttack)
      Create with a custom priority, optionally causing a crowd attack.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AITargetHurtBy

        public AITargetHurtBy()
        Create with an automatically given priority.

      • AITargetHurtBy

        public AITargetHurtBy(boolean crowdAttack)
        Create with an automatically given priority, optionally causing a crowd attack.
        Parameters:
        crowdAttack - if set to true, all nearby entities of the same class are working together to kill the attacker (well, theoretical. not tested.)

      • AITargetHurtBy

        public AITargetHurtBy(int priority)
        Create with a custom priority.
        Parameters:
        priority - the priority of this behavior. Specify 0 to auto-generate it

      • AITargetHurtBy

        public AITargetHurtBy(int priority,
              boolean crowdAttack)
        Create with a custom priority, optionally causing a crowd attack.
        Parameters:
        priority - the priority of this behavior. Specify 0 to auto-generate it
        crowdAttack - if set to true, all nearby entities of the same class are working together to kill the attacker (well, theoretical. not tested.)
